snippet: Robert Dahl, who ran a struggling vineyard, and his chief investor, Emad Tawfilis, were supposed to be settling differences on Monday. They did not.
abstract: Dispute between California vintner Robert Dahl and his chief investor Emad Tawfilis ends in deaths of both men; Napa County sheriff's office says Dahl shot Tawfilis in front of deputies, and later fatally shot himself as officers were closing in on him; friction between men involved $800,000 and additional funds Tawfilis had given Dahl to finance a defunct winery.

byline.original: By RONNIE COHEN and MICHAEL WINES
byline.contributor: Ronnie Cohen reported from Yountville, and Michael Wines from New York. Elisa Cho contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Robert Dahl, who ran a struggling vineyard, and his chief investor, Emad Tawfilis, were supposed to be settling differences on Monday. They did not.

headline.main: A Vineyard Dispute, $800,000 in Cash and Two Dead in Napa
headline.print_headline: A Vineyard Dispute, $800,000 in Cash and Two Dead in Napa
